page.title: 06MY LOCAL PAPER(CONT)
page.content: items.)This year we collected towards the Ethiopian appeal,where thousands are dying of starvation, and also leukaemia research, a total of Â£150.We also compete in local Eisteddfodau throughout the year.Our local paper is named after the rare breed of bird,the Red Kite,which can be found in the area.It covers 17 villages.Other main features of interest in this month's edition are, firstly, a picture of the crowned bard at the National Eisteddfod of Wales,Rhyl.His name is John Roderick Rees,and he lives at Penuwch,a nearby village.He won the crown for composing poetry.There is a club called - the 250 club in our paper.We pay Â£5 and have the chance to win big prizes every month.Two children from Blaenpennal have caught a fox and are keeping it as a pet.Finally all the local sports news.
